ARABIC: وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَا۟ وَأَصْحَٰبَ ٱلرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًۢا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The same goes for 'Ad and Thamud and the Companions of the Well and many generations in between.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (As for) 'Ad, Thamud and the people of ar-Rass, and many generations in between them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Likewise were destroyed the `Ad and the Thamud and the people of the Rass, and many a generation in between.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: To each of the tribes of Ad, Thamud, the settlers around the well and many generations in between
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the tribes of A’ad and the Thamud, and the people of the Wells, and many a generation between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (also) `Ad and Thamud, and the Dwellers of Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And Ad and Samood and the dwellers of the Rass and many generations between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And Ad, and Thamood, and the men of Er-Rass, and between that generations a many,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, and the dwellers in Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: to  'Ad, and Thamud, and the people of al-Rass, and as We did for the many a generation between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the 'Aad and the Thamud and the dwellers of the pass and generations in-between many.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And ‘Ad and Thamud, and the people of Rass, and many generations between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (also) 'Ad and Thamud, and the dwellers of Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: also to Aad and Thamood and the nation of ErRass and many generations in between;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And Aad, and Thamood, and the inhabitants of Arras, and many generations in between.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:38] And, mention, ‘Ād, the people of Hūd, and Thamūd, the people of Sālih, and the dwellers at al-Rass (al-rass) — the name of a ‘well’; their prophet is said to have been Shu‘ayb; although some say it was someone else. [The story is that] they had been sitting around it [on one occasion] when it collapsed beneath them [burying them] together with their dwellings. And many generations, peoples, in between, that is, between [the people of] ‘Ād and the dwellers at al-Rass.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And (the tribes of) 'Aad) and We destroyed the people of Hud (and Thamud) the people of Salih, (and the dwellers in Ar-Rass) the people of Shu'ayb, (and many generations in between) We destroyed them all, even though We have not mentioned them by name.
